definition: marketplace/town/the street (urban milieu)/the haunts of the common people
Jing, one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/surname Jing

sentences.english: Small people talk about other people.
Worldly people bow the knee to success as to god.
sentences.chinese: 市井小人崇拜成功犹如膜拜上帝。

sentences.english: He walked in the city by forces, but cannot make elegant.
sentences.chinese: 他要凭势力走进城市里，但不能做市井之徒。

sentences.english: Zhu Xiaolin's Life of Games depicts a feeling of senselessness in life.
sentences.chinese: 朱小林的“游戏人生”描绘着市井生活里的无聊感。

sentences.english: Qing Ming Shang He Tu and market furniture in Son Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 《清明上河图》与宋代市井家具。

sentences.english: The hay brother is a typical town little businessman too.
sentences.chinese: 郓哥也是个典型的市井小生意人。

sentences.english: Storytelling novels originated from the works of folklore speakers and marketplace writers.
sentences.chinese: 话本小说滥觞于说话艺人和市井文人之作。

sentences.english: It was, for the most part, silly and graced by the current slang.
sentences.chinese: 那些话大部分愚蠢无聊，夹杂着流行的市井喱语。

sentences.english: Let your music, like a sward, pierce the noice of the market to its heart.
sentences.chinese: 让你的音乐如一把利剑，刺穿市井中喧嚣的心吧。

sentences.english: I love early morning runs when Eva is sleeping and the city is just waking.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢慢跑于晨曦之中，艾娃还在梦中，市井弥蒙。

sentences.english: Stealth into the Ying and exposure to the people, elegant contempt.
sentences.chinese: 潜行入茔而曝光其事，为市井之人所不齿。

sentences.english: Verses took up considerable space in marketplace novels of Ming and Qing Dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 明清市井题材小说中诗词占有大量的篇幅。

sentences.english: Ichii were clustered, there are other names for gold ingot ingot also.
sentences.chinese: 市井人丛集，有换元宝还元宝等名”。

sentences.english: This term is composed of two originally irrelavent words: Shi (marketplace) and Jing (well).
sentences.chinese: “市井”一词，是由两个原本没有关系的字组合而成。

definition: lit. peddlers and carriers/common people/lower class
top of streets, bottom of alleys (idiom); everywhere in the city

the Three Religions (Daoism, Confucianism, Buddhism) and Nine Schools (Confucians, Daoists, Yin-Yang, Legalists, Logicians, Mohists, Political Strategists, Eclectics, Agriculturists)/fig. people from all trades (often derog.)
the Shanghai of old, with its foreign settlements/(fig.) a bustling, cosmopolitan city
